label: 上司
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Officials of the Lord of Manors (Ryōshu) or Legal Guardian of Manors (Honke) who met at his residence to conduct his manorial (shōen) and other family affairs. Called Family Officials (Keishi ), if their master was a High Court Noble (Kugyō ). Served as members of the Supreme Administrative Council (Mandokoro ), Supreme Advisory Committee (Hyōjōshū ), Supreme Court (Monchūjo ), and the Supreme Military Council (Samuraidokoro ). [領主、本家、荘園、家司、公卿、政所、評定衆、問注所、侍所]
